qas.question: How many people were evacuated during the invasion?
How long was the city completely empty?
How many garrisoned soldiers were left in Strasbourg?
How many Jews of Strasbourg were evacuated?
On what date did they begin to evacuate the University?
On what date were the Jews of Strasbourg evacuated?

context: Between the <a0_0>German<a0_0/> invasion of Poland on <b7_0>1 September 1939<b7_0/> and the Anglo-French declaration of War against the German Reich on <b8_0>3 September 1939<b8_0/>, the entire city (a total of <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>120,000<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> people) was evacuated, like other border towns as well. Until the arrival of the <a2_0>Wehrmacht troops<a2_0/> mid-June 1940, the city was, for <a3_0>ten months<a3_0/>, completely empty, with the exception of the garrisoned soldiers. The Jews of Strasbourg had been evacuated to Périgueux and Limoges, the University had been evacuated to <a4_0>Clermont-Ferrand<a4_0/>.
